documentContentReferences.name: Screening Procedures Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from the 'PROTOCOL AMENDMENT SUMMARY OF CHANGES TABLE' to Section 8 for details on screening site procedures in the US.

documentContentReferences.name: COVID-19 Vaccine Risk Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 2.3.1.1 to Section 10.5 for potential risks and mitigation measures due to COVID-19 vaccine.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 3 (Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy) to Section 6.6 for dose modification or discontinuation strategy.

documentContentReferences.name: Investigator's Brochure Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 3 to the Investigator’s Brochure (IB) for data on dose-dependent elevations in transaminases.

documentContentReferences.name: Adaptive Design Features Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 4.1 (Overall Design) to Table 4 for a description of adaptive features and their limits.

documentContentReferences.name: Dose Modification Criteria Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: ALXN1840 Dose Modifications for Individual Participants
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Table 4 (Adaptive Protocol Features) to Table 7 for dose modification criteria.

documentContentReferences.name: Contraception Methods Reference
documentContentReferences.sectionTitle: Contraceptive Guidance and Collection of Pregnancy Information
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 5.3 (Lifestyle Considerations) to Section 10.4 for appropriate contraceptive methods.

documentContentReferences.name: Discontinuation Data Collection Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 (Discontinuation of Study Intervention) to the Schedule of Activities for data to be collected at discontinuation.

documentContentReferences.name: Pregnancy Discontinuation Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 7.1 to Section 8.2.6 regarding discontinuation due to pregnancy.

documentContentReferences.name: Lost to Follow-up Definition
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.3 (Follow-up of AEs and SAEs) to Section 7.3 for the definition of lost to follow-up.

documentContentReferences.name: Genetic Testing Policy Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.3.6 (Retained and Biobanked Sample) to Section 8.7 stating that samples will not be used for genetic testing.

documentContentReferences.name: PK/PD Sample Collection Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.6 (Pharmacodynamics) to the SoA (Table 1) for blood sample collection time points.

documentContentReferences.name: Biomarker Measurement Reference
documentContentReferences.description: Reference from Section 8.8 (Biomarkers) to Section 8.1.1 for details of copper measured in food, drink, urine, and feces.

commentAnnotations.text: Addition of text to the footnote to state that procedures specific to screening sites (only in the US) detailed in Section 8
Abbreviations: ALT = alanine aminotransferase; AST = aspartate aminotransferase; IB = Investigator’s Brochure; PK = pharmacokinetics; WD = Wilson disease.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 3: Potential Risks and Mitigation Strategy

commentAnnotations.text: Abbreviations: CRF = case report form; CRU = clinical research unit; EOS = End of Study; SoA = Schedule of Activities.
Abbreviations: ICF = informed consent form; PD = pharmacodynamic; PK = pharmacokinetic.

total molybdenum and PUF molybdenum concentration-time profiles on Day 28 after the last 15 mg ALXN1840 dose will be extrapolated to Day 29 (0-24 hr) and subtracted from the observed Day 29 concentration-time profiles after the first 30 mg

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Protocol Amendment 3.1 (US) to clarify study procedures across different sites in the US.
